recipe.name: Amarillo Amber Ale
recipe.step: Sparge to collect roughly 25 L of wort.
Boil for 90 minutes adding hops at times indicated.
Cool wort to pitching temperature as quickly as possible, 18–24 °C.
Transfer wort to sanitized fermenter then pitch the yeast.
Dry hops are added loose to the carboy and soaked for two weeks after primary fermentation is complete.

recipe.name: Guinness Draught clone
recipe.step: Heat 10 L of water to 72 °C and stir in crushed grains and flaked barley.
Stir boiling water into grain bed until temperature reaches 76 °C and rest for 5 minutes.
Recirculate until wort is clear, then begin running wort off to kettle.
Boil wort for 90 minutes, adding hops with 60 minutes left in boil.
Cool wort and transfer to fermenter.
Rack to secondary when fermentation is complete.
Bottle a few days later, when beer falls clear. If beer is kegged, consider pushing with a nitrogen blend (see the Jan-Feb 2005 issue for more information on this).
